A. Beat The Odds

Given a sequence ğ‘1,ğ‘2,â€¦,ğ‘ğ‘›, find the minimum number of elements to remove from the sequence such that after the removal, the sum of every 2 consecutive elements is even.

B. Shoe Shuffling

A class of students got bored wearing the same pair of shoes every day, so they decided to shuffle their shoes among themselves. In this problem, a pair of shoes is inseparable and is considered as a single object.

There are ğ‘› students in the class, and you are given an array ğ‘  in non-decreasing order, where ğ‘ ğ‘– is the shoe size of the ğ‘–-th student. A shuffling of shoes is valid only if no student gets their own shoes and if every student gets shoes of size greater than or equal to their size.

You have to output a permutation ğ‘ of {1,2,â€¦,ğ‘›} denoting a valid shuffling of shoes, where the ğ‘–-th student gets the shoes of the ğ‘ğ‘–-th student (ğ‘ğ‘–â‰ ğ‘–). And output âˆ’1 if a valid shuffling does not exist.

A permutation is an array consisting of ğ‘›
distinct integers from 1 to ğ‘› in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2 appears twice in the array) and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (ğ‘›=3 but there is 4 in the array).

For example, for the string ğ‘ =1011:

Consider repeatedly moving one of the pieces to one of the four adjacent squares. It is not allowed to move the piece outside the grid. How many moves are required at minimum for the piece to reach the square with the other piece?

entry.title: ABC251 A-Fé¢˜è§£
entry.content:
A.Six Characters

Problem Statement

You are given a string S consisting of lowercase English characters. The length of S is between 1 and 3, inclusive.

Print the string of length 6 that is a repetition of S.

It can be shown that there uniquely exists such a string under the Constraints of this problem.

Constraints

S is a string consisting of lowercase English characters of length between 1 and 3, inclusive.

é¢˜è§£

å¾ˆç®€å•

B. At Most 3 (Judge ver.)

Problem Statement

There are N weights called Weight 1, Weight 2, â€¦, Weight N. Weight i has a mass of Aiâ€‹.
Let us say a positive integer n is a good integer if the following condition is satisfied:

  • We can choose at most 3 different weights so that they have a total mass of n.

How many positive integers less than or equal to W are good integers?

Constraints

  • 1â‰¤Nâ‰¤300
  • 1â‰¤Wâ‰¤1e6
  • 1â‰¤Aiâ€‹â‰¤1e6
  • All values in input are integers.

C.Poem Online Judge

Problem Statement

Poem Online Judge (POJ) is an online judge that gives scores to submitted strings.
There were N submissions to POJ. In the i-th earliest submission, string Siâ€‹ was submitted, and a score of

Tiâ€‹ was given. (The same string may have been submitted multiple times.)
Note that POJ may not necessarily give the same score to submissions with the same string.

A submission is said to be an original submission if the string in the submission is never submitted in any earlier submission.
A submission is said to be the best submission if it is an original submission with the highest score. If there are multiple such submissions, only the earliest one is considered the best submission.

Find the index of the best submission.

Constraints

  • 1â‰¤Nâ‰¤1e5
  • Siâ€‹ is a string consisting of lowercase English characters.
  • Siâ€‹ has a length between 1 and 10, inclusive.
  • 0â‰¤Tiâ€‹â‰¤1e9
  • N and Tiâ€‹ are integers.

D.At Most 3 (Contestant ver.)

Problem Statement

You are given an integer W.
You are going to prepare some weights so that all of the conditions below are satisfied.

  • The number of weights is between 1 and 300, inclusive.
  • Each weight has a mass of positive integer not exceeding 1e6.
  • Every integer between 1 and W, inclusive, is a good integer. Here, a positive integer n is said to be a good integer if the following condition is satisfied:
    • We can choose at most 3 different weights from the prepared weights with a total mass of n.
      Print a combination of weights that satisfies the conditions.

Constraints

  • 1â‰¤Wâ‰¤1e6
  • W is an integer.

é¢˜ç›®å¤§æ„

é€†å‘æ±‚Bé¢˜

E.Takahashi and Animals

Problem Statement

Takahashi is with N animals. The N animals are called Animal 1, Animal 2, â€¦, Animal N.
Takahashi will perform the following N kinds of action. Each action can be performed any number of (possibly zero) times.

  • Pay A1â€‹ yen (the currency in Japan) to feed Animals 1 and 2.
  • Pay A2â€‹ yen to feed Animals 2 and 3.
  • Pay A3â€‹ yen to feed Animals 3 and 4.
  • â€¦
  • Pay Aiâ€‹ yen to feed Animals i and (i+1).
  • â€¦
  • Pay ANâˆ’2â€‹ yen to feed Animals (Nâˆ’2) and (Nâˆ’1).
  • Pay ANâˆ’1â€‹ yen to feed Animals (Nâˆ’1) and N.
  • Pay ANâ€‹ yen to feed Animals N and 1.
    Note that the N-th action above feeds â€œAnimals N and 1.â€
    Print the minimum possible total cost to feed every animal at least once.

Constraints

  • 2â‰¤Nâ‰¤3Ã—1e5
  • 1â‰¤Aiâ€‹â‰¤1e9
  • All values in input are integers.

F.Two Spanning Trees

Problem Statement

You are given an undirected graph
G with N vertices and M edges.
G is simple (it has no self-loops and multiple edges) and connected.
For i=1,2,â€¦,M, the i-th edge is an undirected edge {uiâ€‹,viâ€‹} connecting Vertices uiâ€‹ and viâ€‹.
Construct two spanning trees T1â€‹ and T2â€‹ of G that satisfy both of the two conditions below. (T1â€‹ and T2â€‹ do not necessarily have to be different spanning trees.)

  • T1â€‹ satisfies the following.

    If we regard T1â€‹ as a rooted tree rooted at Vertex 1, for any edge {u,v} of G not contained in T1â€‹, one of u and v is an ancestor of the other in T1

  • T2â€‹ satisfies the following.

    If we regard T2â€‹ as a rooted tree rooted at Vertex 1, there is no edge {u,v} of G not contained in T2â€‹ such that one of u and v is an ancestor of the other in T2â€‹.
    We can show that there always exists T1â€‹ and T2â€‹ that satisfy the conditions above.

Constraints

  • 2â‰¤Nâ‰¤2Ã—1e5
  • Nâˆ’1â‰¤Mâ‰¤min{2Ã—1e5,N(Nâˆ’1)/2}
  • 1â‰¤uiâ€‹,viâ€‹â‰¤N
  • All values in input are integers.
  • The given graph is simple and connected.

There exists, among teenagers and youngster, s hot debate on the importance of motivation and methods in learning. From my perspective, it is motivation and methods that prove to be more crucial than the study itself.

Quite a few factors, as a matter of fact, could account for opinion. As the primary element, Motivation can make us brave in front of difficulties. If we desire to complete heavy tasks smoothly, it is motivation that would make us be confronted with troubles without fear. One of Chinese famous businessmen, Mayun, is a good case in point. Before he became the top man known to all, he had failed thousands of times. Without motivation, he might got nothing. Besides, proper methods are crucial. Because right ways enable you to attain what you want rapidly and effective. The more efficiently you study, the greater success you will achieve.

In a word, motivation and methods play a vital role in the study of youngsters. So parents should educate their kids to study with a right method and motivation. As a university student, we should explore more effectively ways to learn. Only in such ways of thinking can our work be done rapidly and comfortably.

There is no doubt that the issue about community responsibility has caused wide public attention recently. From my perspective, it is indispensable both in social development and individual improvement.

It is quite a few causes that could account for my argument. First and foremost, not only is a strong sense of community responsibility helpful to develop harmonious interpersonal relationships but also is beneficial to personal development. As we all know, the sound working atmosphere and interpersonal relationships among employees are crucial to both physical and mental pleasure. In addition, community responsibility can improve efficiency in the fast-paced modern society where time is money and efficiency holds the key to success. As a saying goes,â€united, we stand; divided, we fallâ€. So great importance should be attached to the cultivation of the sense of community responsibility and we will eventually benefit from it.

From what has been mentioned above, we can safely draw the conclusion that sense of community responsibility is a kind of good personal quality, which deserves our attention. So it is worth of our attention under modern conditions. Only in this way can we have a harmonious society.
